Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location, rooms”
Reviews.Author: Luke S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near the YUL, Montreal airport. Rooms are awesome, it is worth paying the 15$ more for a suite. It has a seperate living room divided by a wall to the bed area, includes a mini fridge and a microwave. There is a pool and exersice room, free breakfast, a bar in the evening. 24 hour free coffee and free shuttle to the airport. As you will notice from previous reviews, there has been constructions for at least 2 or 3 years now. I call this "job security" for the construction workers as it is very slow paced. This is not the hotel fault, they actually opened before this mess started up. If you know what roads to take, you will be fine. From highway 20, go towards 520 est, after the underpass, keep the right then go in the Best Western parking, at the other exit, just cross the street. From 520, exit at the airport, follow signs for Cardinal street (left at Aloft/Sheraton hotels), once you get to a spot where you can only go left or right, take the left, cross the bridge, the hotel is on the right. Hint: Cardinal Street is the same street of the hotel. Once at the hotel, they have a map how to navigate around and help you leave and come back. I recommend this hotel. The new building, and room rates is worth the construction area.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: OttawaGlebe
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at the Fairfield Inn every time I travel out of Montreal's Dorval Airport. The hotel is conveniently located next to the airport...while at the same time shielding you from the noise of airplanes taking off and landing. The hotel has very affordable rates, comfortable rooms, a very cozy hotel restaurant and a reliable complimentary (around the clock) shuttle service to the airport. Not the biggest pillow connoisseur, but the Down Dreams duck pillows really help in getting a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hotelreview77
Reviews.Content: Big rooms, nice parking lot, clean premises. This is a new hotel with all the amenities you will need. Stayed overnight during freak snowstorm in US. Free breakfast included, even the free coffee tastes good. Great experience for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable modern rooms, hard to find hotel and lots of railroad and airport noise”
Reviews.Author: jamesmorton
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel. The rooms are very comfortable (spend the extra money for the larger rooms) and the food is good. There's a nice pool. The downsides? Parking isn't free and it is very hard to find the hotel - you have to drive through the Best Western parking lot to get to the hotel. And there is railroad and airport noise. Still overall a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport and nothing else”
Reviews.Author: DorashCalgary
Reviews.Content: I had a one day conference at University of Montreal. As this was a last minute booking, and flights were limited, I managed to get this hotel close to airport (arrived late at night). Was not that convenient to other facilities, but 5 mins from airport (with free shuttle). Had everything you would need in a room. Everything (room and facilities) tidy. Minimal options for supper. No restaurants in surrounding area...Good value for money and comfortable sleep.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Near The Airport!!”
Reviews.Author: beachguy18
Reviews.Content: As soon as I walked in the door I was greeted by Colinie at the front desk who makes you feel right at home with her charm and smile. Check-in was fast, the food in the lounge was good, the room was very clean and modern and the breakfast was delicious! It was one of the best places in that price range I had ever stayed in. A king-sized bed in a large room, breakfast, free shuttle to the airport and two weeks of parking all for $139.00. Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: genny80
Reviews.Content: We staded here one nigth before taking of on vacation the room was nice and clean we had a great service at the front desk. The person's in the room next to are's where not as nice very loud dancing an signing so sleep was not a option with them we call the front desk and they did send someone up but 2 second's after he left they where rigth back at it... grrrrrrrr not the hotel's fault at all... we used the park and fly end had no problemes at all the bus was on time both way's! so I would go back for the park and fly next time I go on a trip!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: HicEtNunc
Reviews.Content: All good points: Clean, modern rooms, excellent soundproofing, good breakfast (included), nice bar with adequate menu, excellent and very reliable 24 hour shuttle service to airport, up to 14 days secure parking included in package, very helpful and competent staff.

Reviews.Title: “not your choice for long term parking”
Reviews.Author: brulot
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the FAIRFIELD in Dania , Florida ; we are now looking at a january PARK & FLY booking near the Dorval airport in Montreal and we gave preference to the FAIRFIELD INN in Dorval as we were fully satisfied with our stay there in Florida. They have a good PARK & FLY package for up to a 28 day parking stay but additional days are priced at 9 $. a day while the competition is charging anywhere from 3 to 5 $. per day for additional days of parking. It is unfortunate that this hotel is pricing itself out of the market due to overpriced long term parking fees. Food for tought & action Mr. Lamoureux. G.T.

Reviews.Title: “New, Comfotable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve1362
Reviews.Content: The hotel appeared to be brand new and was in a convenient to the airport. My stay was very comfortable and breakfast was good enough. There was a lot of construction in the area so one could not get out and stretch their legs and parking was limited. Overall, the stay was fine and I got a good nightâ€™s sleep and I would stay here again for a night while on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great place ...hard to get to... for now”
Reviews.Author: Sk8dad
Reviews.Content: Due to ongoing construction at the Montreal Airport... I could see where I wanted to go but it took driving with a GPS and knowing to short cut through the Best Western parking lot across the street to get there! This is a beautiful property - nice breakfast area, which also serves a limited selection of food in the evening; nicely appointed rooms, and very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms for great price”
Reviews.Author: Luke S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice and found this to be a very decent property. Very clean, rooms very nice. The breakfast could be better tasting and selection/taste is poor. I recommend this place for overnight stays.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overnighting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PPWA
Reviews.Content: Good convenient hotel to overnight in Montreal. Nice clean rooms and environs. Complimentary breakfast daily. No restaurants on the premises except for the small breakfast area. So there is a challenge getting lunch or dinner. The best recourse is to call restaurants and order food to be delivered to you at the hotel. Staff is courteous and helpful. This helps to make your stay as comfortable as can be, considering the lack of meal choices. Great for business layovers. I actually stayed at this hotel May 28, 2010 - June 2, 2010

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Larry K
Reviews.Content: This property is very beautiful and is extremely well maintained. The entire building is smoke free and pets are NOT allowed which is good for people with allergies. The business centre has three computers for public use, so there was never any wait. The free breakfast was excellent with the usual items, but also included scrambled eggs. Every staff member encountered was fully bi-lingual and extremely friendly and accommodating. There is a $9/day fee for parking which is a reasonable cost. Note: if you get a room on the backside of the hotel, you will be overlooking a main railway line so there may be some noise from passing trains and of course, there is the aesthetic value. At the time our stay, there was considerable construction on the roadway system going to the airport, so access to and from the hotel required some detours. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Dmitry B
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 16 nights. The regular room was not good. No fridge, no microwave, no safe.. Had to upgrade to suite (for additional fee of course) which was OK. Suite had.. I would not call it kitchen or kitchenette.. Let's say, suite had a place where fridge, micro and a coffee maker was put :) But overall the room was OK. Positive: - Nice clean suite. - Girls at the front desk were really helpful. - Nice lobby. - Shuttle to work almost at request. - Convenient parking Negative: - Breakfast is continental - No restaurant in the hotel. Just bar which is open at evening and has very limited and not very good menu. - Could not find any food delivery to this hotel. - Air conditioning is not very good. - The hotel is near to nothing but the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stop over”
Reviews.Author: spacemanspiff85
Reviews.Content: stay : 1night, 08/30. double room My flight from Europe to the US was rescheduled (due to Hurricane Irene) and I was told 24hours earlier that I had to take a 1-night stopover at Trudeau Airport Quebec. All in all, I didn't have much time to find what I was looking for ; an available double bed room, very clean, not too far away from the airport and as affordable as possible. The Fairfield Inn met my expectations. More than that, we got a spacious room and a very friendly staff. The hotel (not to be mistaken with the other "Mariott Airport" adjacent to the airport) is accessible by hotel vans (complimentary hotel shuttle service) joining the airport and the hotel every 30mins. The ride lasts less than 15mins. On that note, the hotel is pretty isolated. Apart from the hotel restaurant itself (not 24h open), there's no restaurant or fastfood in the surroundings. and no bus stop either. So, if you don't have a car, the only way to go in town is to take this shuttle service back to the airport and then, take the bus that leads you to the town centre. I remember train tracks running in the back of the hotel, but I probably got lucky that my room was facing the other side (the airport) because I didn't get disturbed by any noise and spent an amazingly quiet and comfy night there.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned, extensive construction detours makes it impossible to reach Hotel. Guest are not warned ahead of time”
Reviews.Author: crusty888
Reviews.Content: I was a Platinum Marriott Rewards member (75 nights) for many years. The bad ecomony of the last years have reduced my traveling , to Gold (50 nights) , now I am currently a silver member. My stay at this hotel has been one of the most frustrating of my total of 250+ nights with Marriott. First, I was told that I had to pay $15 per night for a refrigerator, that I require for storing medication. I have never been told of any costs in all the previous times this has been granted. The Marriott Rewards Agent said she had never been told of this before as well. Someone from Marriott called the Hotel on my behalf. I was then called by the Fairfield to say my request was granted at no cost. On the next day coming back to the hotel from downtown Montreal, it told us over an hour to make it the 1/2 mile to the hotel Due to extensive construction, that the hotel staff did not mention at check-in the evening before, ( we arrived by hotel shuttle) it is possible to get to the hotel using any of the maps or garmin (which i updated with North American maps the day before we left). We drive by the hotel over and over again. We finally stopped at a Aloft and asked the bartender for directions. He told us this was happening all the time and advised us to go back go to the Trudeau Airport Arrivals, that was the simplest way to get to the hotel. Which in utter frustration and desperation we did! Sitting in airport traffic! When we finally got back to the hotel. The front desk staff tried us as if it was our fault. We asked if there had a map with the new detours. It was at this point that they pulled out the map that we should have been given at check-in to warn us AHEAD OF TIME. The extension construction detours was not only time-consuming but DANGEROUS! Multiple lanes of traffic being merged into single lanes! The trick is to drive into the Best Western Parking lot and drive around it. Who would have guessed that it was possible. I asked why there were signs. I was told there was 1 small one, but the Front Desk agent admitted it was very small. Unlit it is impossble to see at night. I can not imagine why the Fairfield would not care about the safety and the inconveniencing of their guest, to simply advised ahead of time at reservation or at check-in. The General Manager has yet to contact me. The positives: The property is a very stylish Farifield. Has a business center with 3 pc, a bar with a light menu and a very nicely maintained breakfast room. The ladies who work in the breakfast room are very nice, greeting everyone brightly and hard working, spotless. Negatives: heard the 2 Front Office staff ( both young Asian women, I am Asian too) trash talking about a guest they did not like. I was getting coffee at the coffee stand right next to front desk and could not believe they were not even trying to keep their voices down!

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms, but very noisy due to passing trains”
Reviews.Author: --Roman_PA--
Reviews.Content: The room I was in was large enough (king) and well maintained. Staff seem to be very friendly. As a cons, I would consider: Noise (it's significant at evening/night) from passing trains - tracks are just beside hotel, so you cannot ignore it. Slow internet connection - Skype is not really usable. No ammenities in the walking distance, you have to drive or use shuttle to the airport. Breakfast is exactly as any other Farfield. Hint: If driving the car from RT20, enter via Best Western parking lot, otherwise due to construction it's a bit hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean and New - Montreal's Best Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sftn
Reviews.Content: Big rooms, Clean. New and well kept. You can count on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a Fairfield”
Reviews.Author: kovacicn
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of Fairfield's and this was one of there better properties. It is by the airport, but there isn't anything around there. The only place to eat is in the hotel, which has a very limited menu but the food is decent. If your in and out of the airport this is a very nice place to stay. It is economically priced and has newer bedding and decor. I would recommend if your there for a limited amount of time.

Reviews.Title: “Money Well Spent”
Reviews.Author: 123nelson
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed at the Fairfield Inn for 2 nights, the hotel should be a 4-star, the staff is super friendly, accommodating, knowledgeable, and very helpful. The front office agent "Nazir" gave me a full understanding of their transit system. I learned how to read their maps, and were able to travel the city without getting lost. Great staff! Everyone was very helpful. They gave me hints, and excellent tips of the city. The staff were very helpful, the shuttle drivers were very polite and sociable. Our room was super clean, very cozy, and modern. The breakfast was quite delicious! The hotel is close to the airport, however you won't hear the planes, or the street construction. We stayed at room 920 and it was very quiet. It's probably best not to rent a car in this city, we made that decision and we are so glad we did. Their gas is measured in liter, it's $6.75 per gallon, everywhere charges for parking. It could range from $10-$50 daily for parking. If you're flying in, there's no need to rent a car. Right now the Canadian dollar is worth more than the American dollar. For the best exchange rate, go to a bank, the airport and hotels have higher exchange rates. Fairfield inn was an excellent hotel, provided my husband and I with a clean room, delicious breakfast, transportation, & a knowledgeable & helpful staff at a reasonable price!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Accommodating”
Reviews.Author: JacqueOH
Reviews.Content: It is important to remember that this is a Fairfield Hotel. On our recent trip we stayed at a number of Fairfields and Courtyards. We found that they are all roomy, clean and have great beds. They are not five star hotels, but provide excellent value for the price! We found the service to be top notch at each one we stayed at. This hotel is clean and well maintained. It was by an airport and train, so there is some noise to contend with. I am generally bothered by noise, but since this is mostly white noise I did not have a problem. It is difficult to get to, but we found Montreal difficult to get around in general. There is lots of construction and the highway systems are not very well organized.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: justjo30
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, interior is nice, rooms are big, and breakfast is decent. There isn't anything in the surrounding area except the airport. Would be great for an airport stay. We stayed here to visit the city because it was less expensive than staying downtown and we had a car. The local train service does go downtown, but it is not convenient. The bus service is the better option. Front desk staff was very accommodating. Free wifi was nice. Due to the local construction, it may be difficult to find your way into the property the first time but, after you know where to go it's easy. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best VALUE upscale hotels in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: WorldOneNY
Reviews.Content: A very new hotel, the Fairfield Inn is a large hotel facility near the airport with VERY easy (10 minute) access to downtown Montreal by car/rental car. Compared to other disappointing and "tired"Marriott hotels this hotel exceeds expectations for service, atmosphere and overall value. It almost doesn't seem like it fits with other worn out, awful Marriotts worldwide (Marriott needs to overall do a lot to improve their tacky outdated decor in many of their locations). This hotel is a gem. Location is easy to get to, the entrance is worthy of a posh hotel with free internet, bar area, flat screen tvs, lounge area in a very chic European modern decor - the designer of this hotel gets 5 stars for overall impression/comfort. The service is comparable to 5 star hotels - friendly, multilingual, accommodating. The hotel is kept in order and very clean. The rooms are roomy, modern, beautifully decorated, bath areas are modern and clean, flat screen tv, lounge chair and perks with gym area and free breakfast. The ONLY complaint is that they now charge for secure parking which I found unacceptable - parking should be free if you are a guest... but this is part of the problem with Marriott hotels - they usually charge for silly things and why I no longer use Marriott hotels in general in addition to their tacky 1980 decor treatments. The overall value is Excellent despite disappointing parking fee. The only other complaint is that while you get so much to eat at breakfast from cereals to eggs to waffles they fail to provide fresh fruit salad.

Reviews.Title: “Montreal 05/2011”
Reviews.Author: blueskies15-10
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to the airport, has no shuttle service, rooms are with all necessary equipment, free internet, decent brerakfast is included in the room rate. even if we were close to the airport, the night was quiet and I slept well. flat screen TV, no fitness room available. parking is free, about 10 miles to the city

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel surrounded by road work”
Reviews.Author: minnimae
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself lives up to its Marriott reputation. Flat screen TV, clean sheets & linens, friendly multilingual staff which aims to please. Windows in room open up slightly. The hotel is not on flight path; the construction in daytime is probably noisier than the airplanes (if you open your windows). Free breakfast is offered, which is not a standard in Montreal hotels. Parking is $9/day (Montreal is notorious for parking fees! Free parking is rare). Carry coins; it helps @ parking meters otherwise you will use a credit card & additional fees will incur. At the moment, there is heavy duty road construction surrounding the vicinity of this hotel; looks like this road work will take at least a year to finish at the rate they are going. It will take you a couple of hit or miss and driving around before you eventually get to it. As of this writing, April 2011, you have to go through Best Western's (same owner) parking lot and cross over. Railroad is next to parking lot; only saw and heard 1 train in our 5 day stay. Food places are distant; you have to drive round & round. Hotel has a bar and a little convenience (candy, soda, sandwich) section by the lobby, but no restaurant; it only serves breakfast. Not much to do on this part of town....most of the action & sightseeing are in dowtown = 20 minutes without traffic. Do not miss Old Montreal + Olympic Parc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel without many frills or nearby restaurants”
Reviews.Author: psprof
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night on a layover in Montreal. The hotel was a good value near the airport and I had a really big clean room. The room was actually spotless and looked brand new like no one had stayed in the room before. So, it was a nice pleasant room. The airport shuttle was a little difficult to get from the airport. I could not find a courtesy phone from the airport to this hotel. I called the Marriott hotel instead, which was listed as one of the hotels connected by the courtesy phone. They connected me to the Fairfield Inn so that I could ask about the shuttle. This was a little annoying but worked out fine in the end. I ate dinner in the lounge, which was not bad, but nothing special. The food was fine and the place was really busy. There seemed to be only one server/bar tender, but she did a great job managing all the customers and getting the food out. The menu is quite limited, but they have some simple sandwiches and bar food. The wine list is pretty poor but is understandable for an inexpensive business hotel. There is also a place to eat in the hotel across the street if you wanted a more sit-down style meal. Some places on google were listed nearby, but I suspect you need a car or a taxi. Walking does not seem to be a good idea from this location. The location is surrounded by highways and construction. It is a really poor location in terms of anything but the airport unless you have a car. Free breakfast is always nice. The breakfast was good for this type of hotel. The shuttle to the airport in the morning was very easy for me. The driver was just waiting there and took me when I was ready. I guess there were no other customers and no one else waiting, so I was able to get it on-demand. Otherwise, the shuttle runs every 30 minutes, so plan accordingly

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fionalw
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield Inn really failed on service. Their airport shuttle was terrible which is inexcusable for an airport hotel. It apparently runs on a 30 minute schedule, but it's completely unreliable and sporadic. It's impossible to reach a live person when calling the hotel - you'll wait on hotel for ever. They got our hotel reservation wrong and gave us a king bed when we reserved two doubles - not much you can do with a king with 4 people in the room!! We had to wait until 9pm to find out they didn't have a crib for us when they had assured us many times they had a crib. The restaurant menu is pretty disappointing - it's VERY limited. All in all, we had 2 terrible stays there. Note that we booked through stay123 dot com for a parking+hotel package. Rates were cheaper than going directly through the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Debbie266
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very short ride from the airport. Although we had our own vehicle the hotel does provide a complimentary shuttle service. The reception area is very nice and has a warm feeling. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was quite spacious and very clean. Overall, this hotel was very impressive and I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The most impressive Fairfield Inn I have ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: TraderJohn
Reviews.Content: When a colleague suggested we stay at the Fairfield Inn I was not excited. I have stayed with them before and their value to me is as a lower priced, less frills Marriott division. Wow, was I surprised. A beautiful new multi-story hotel with beautifully appointed rooms. A pleasure to experience and still reasonably priced. Friendly staff ,good bar, and a good breakfast offerings. Location is just outside Montreal Airport and perfect for a short business stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Park& Fly (only)”
Reviews.Author: Mailmanwill
Reviews.Content: Great for Park & Fly out of Pierre Trudeau Airport but I would not stay here to visit Montreal. Up to 28 days for around $200,00 and a pretty good breakfast and quiet rooms. Two sets of doors to our room so we almost slept in and missed our flight since it was sooo quiet. Shuttle to and from airport is every half hour so you don't wait long when you arrive. The pool is nice and they have a little fitness room. The area around the hotel is very ugly so I hope anyone who visits Montreal for the first time stays closer to downtown so they can enjoy the real Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly quiet and very spotless”
Reviews.Author: jjejermaster
Reviews.Content: Despite being close to the airport, It was very quiet and I was not disturbed by the planes taking off. The hotel is spotless and staff efficient and very friendly. The room was a suite with microwave and small fridge and huge, I was extremely impressed. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel at Montreal Airport”
Reviews.Author: stefi1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at this hotel and we chose it because it is close to YUL Montreal Airport and a relative we wanted to visit. It is a basic hotel, good if you have to stay close to the airport, certainly not the best choice if you want to visit the city. The room we had was normal size, with a big and really confortable King Size bed with european style duvet. Standard american bathroom, plain and without any amenities but clean, and usual built-in small closet. The only in-room complimentary amenities are: coffee and tea maker, wi-fi internet connection and a flat-screen TV set with a good range of Northamerican channels. There are no mini-fridge nor safe-box. In spite of being so close to the airport, our room was pretty quiet during the night, it turns a little bit noisy due to the traffic on the road during the day. A minus of the hotel is about eating: there is no room service and inside the hotel there is just a sort of cafeteria located directly on the lobby, where you can have a drink and some light food - but if you want a proper meal you have to drive somewhere. The breakfast is included in the rate and is served at the cafeteria: the choice is pretty good and includes boiled eggs, yogurt, fruit and even hot waffel, the only problem is that there is not so much room and at peak time it can be really crowded. If you have a car (which you would need for sure!) there is a private parking lot just in front of the hotel for 9 $ per day. We would recommend this hotel just for one night or two and just if you have to stay close to the airport. The quality is pretty good if you want just a place to sleep and rest.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying at a five-star city hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SeaDays22
Reviews.Content: We researched TripAdvisor prior to booking a one-night pre-cruise hotel stay at Montreal's Trudeau Airport. Since we arrived in the evening, and had to go through a long wait for immigration and customs, there was no need to book anything extravagant. Prior reviews were very accurate. The hotel is one of the closest to the airport (less than a mile), and only about a year-and-a-half old. Since we arrived at the international section of YUL, finding the shuttle van stop was a bit of a chore, but a call from the airport hotel direct line solved it immediately. (It leaves from section 10 or 11. Sections don't become obvious until you exit). Staff was incredibly friendly. Our room was modern, bright, and probably the cleanest hotel room we've stayed at years. On the desk was a welcome note (personalized with our name) and complimentary water bottles. As noted in reviews, there is no eating or shopping establishments in the area. But unlike most Fairfields, this one had a bar/bistro which stayed open until 11 PM. Grilled sandwiches, pizza, or salads were served by the bartender, who also served us a half-life of house red (not bad). Hit the spot. For the price of the meal, we also received great conversation with the bartender, who retrieved a map and outlined things to do in Old Montreal before our cruise the next day. He, plus the rest of the staff made us feel we were staying in and exclusive in-city five-star hotel. In fact, they were probably friendlier. The morning breakfast was not as extensive as that of some hotel chains, but in line with Fairfield. Room price was among the lowest in the area, excluding the dives. We were not bothered by planes (our room was on the airport side), nor the train which is very close to the property. Heard just one all night. The front desk will order a taxi if you need to travel to downtown, or people traveling light can use public transport from the airport. We would stay here again in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms Good Breakfast at Fairfield Suites Montreal Airport”
Reviews.Author: chasPowel
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed three nights at the Fairfield Inn and Suites Montreal Airport. We were drawn there by the low rate, room with two queens and a pull out couch that could sleep our family comfortably, free breakfast and a location not terribly far from Montreal. We weren't disappointed, the rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable with a flat screen TV, microwave and refrigerator with a small freezer compartment. Plus there was free Wi-Fi in the rooms. With reasonable traffic we could drive to Montreal in 20 minutes. Breakfast was a selection of cold foods with the addition of microwave breakfast casadias (yes really.) On Monday morning they broke out the waffle maker. When I booked the motel on-line they added a 45$/day charge for a fifth person in the room but they took this off at the hotel since the fifth person was a child. I also expected to get charged for the on-site parking but the fee was never added to the bill. The only complication is the ongoing construction in the area, but my GPS guided us through it. Enjoyed the traffic roundabouts. I was very pleased with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel...Terrible Terrible location”
Reviews.Author: MikeMB
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean hotel. Looks new to me. Breakfast area was overflowing in the morning. But the location of the hotel is in a terrible and confusing place. I would like to stay here again but wouldn't just because of the location. /Mike

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Large Room”
Reviews.Author: jubejube
Reviews.Content: PROS: This is a beautiful, fairly new hotel. We were given a very large room with a huge bathroom. The queen beds were very comfortable. Even though it's across the street from the airport, our room was fairly quiet. We could watch the planes taking off and landing from our window. The room was reasonably priced (we paid the CAA rate of $98) and a continental breakfast was included free of charge. CONS: Because of the road configurations and some extensive construction, it took us 20 minutes to get to the hotel once we could see it. We drove around in circles and couldn't quite get to it. There is no restaurant on-site, only a lounge/bar that provides a small and expensive selection of finger foods, plus some sandwiches and drinks that could be purchased at the front desk. There were no vending machines anywhere and no fast food outlet within walking distance. The breakfast room was totally inadequate for the number of guests. We lined up out the door to get in. It was like a huge feeding frenzy! People spilled out into the bar and lobby to eat their breakfast. Despite the problems, I would definitely stay here again because of the beautiful rooms and great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: iqtsarah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Marriott properties for a 3 day trip to Montreal. I didn't stayed at the hotels in the downtown area because they're more pricey. Plus we have a car so it's alright to drive to the city do all the activities and then drive back at night. Breakfast is included and the room was big and clean. We enjoyed our stay here. The self-made waffles were so good in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Don't try booking a roll away bed.”
Reviews.Author: MattyOregon
Reviews.Content: I booked at here because the reviews were so great. We booked 2 rooms and requested a roll away bed in each. We arrived late and neither room had a roll away bed, had I known this we would have just booked a larger room. After an hour of back and forth with the reception, there were no other rooms available to move to and each child had to sleep on the floor. The reception was not helpful in any way and gave us the run around. There are tons of other hotels in the area, I would recommend that you find another if you are traveling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel with Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: skull0107
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an Exec room while attending the Canadian Grand Prix in June. The Hotel is new so everything is in great condition and room was very big and well laid out. Every member of staff we met over the weekend were great and really helpful and friendly. Our room faced onto the Railway tracks but we didnâ€™t get any real noise from them. Breakfast is self service and is perfect. Hotel is located beside the train station and Bus station so its an easy commute into the city. We will stay here again when we are back in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; ask for a room overlooking main parking lot”
Reviews.Author: Canada_Turtle
Reviews.Content: This review is written by a business travel who frequents Marriott and Hilton brand hotels throughout the world (primarily in the US). This review is based on a three-night stay in May 2010. I can confirm what a number of previous reviewers wrote; here are my highlights: Pros: - Close proximity to the airport. - New hotel (meets or exceeds standard for all new Fairfield Inns, for those of you that frequent the Marriott brand of hotels). - Great service in French and English. - Good-sized rooms with an expansive channel guide for the TV, and larger washrooms (with light above the shower) makes for a comfortable stay. - Nice-sized pool and exercise room in the basement for this class of hotel. - Neat feature most Fairfield Inns do not have is the cafe/bar in the lobby which serves drinks and light meals / pub fare until 23:00. - Low price is always nice. Opportunities for improvement: - Train noise immediately behind hotel will likely disturb light sleepers (day and night). Request a room overlooking the main parking lot out front. (My wife and I had one night there - fabulous; two nights on the train side - not so good.) - $9 per day for parking (or any paid parking) is unusual for a Fairfield Inn. - Marriott Rewards Platinum members will be surprised to find that you are only offered a choice of points or a music download card upon check-in (and not the usual selection from the Market) - perhaps this is a property or Quebec-only thing? - Not the fault of the hotel, but navigation in and out of the hotel can be difficult based on the multiple roundabouts and constant construction (not much has changed in the last 12 months), even with a GPS. - Some distance from Montreal town centre. Overall, I have rated the hotel highly and would stay here again (and recommend the property to family and friends). Those travelers visiting Montreal should know that staying here will require some travel time (15-20 minutes) by car to reach Montreal downtown / Bell Centre / Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bravo1950
Reviews.Content: close to airport and easy access to downtown. very clean and staff is very helpfull. Good Wi Fi included and good breakfast included in price. Parking at $9 per day is excessive. Overall an OK place to stay short term. a bit too expensive compared to comparable hotels in the area. Hard to access if you are not familiar with the ridiculous traffic circle within a traffic circle road set up. The city of Dorval and the airport authority really need to get it together and try to make things user friendly re signage & access. It's Montreal so don't hold your breath waiting for that to happen.

Reviews.Title: “Great night sleep for early morning flight.........”
Reviews.Author: VermontFluffy
Reviews.Content: The elevator was not working for a short amount of time and staff carried our luggage up seven flights of stairs,worked fine in the morning.. I was concerned about the noise factor I had read about,apparently they added extra windows. We were on the 7th floor ,train station side. I am a light sleeper and did not have any problems with noise. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff friendly and accommodating. The breakfast starts officially at 630am but we were able to eat at 6am as we needed to get to the airport. The food was good and plentiful. I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again. Seems easier to get to from the airport than going to airport.

Reviews.Author: expatsing
Reviews.Content: My experience with this hotel didn`t start on a good note to say the least. At -25 degrees, we could see the hotel from the highway, but how to get to it? Geez, we circled around the hotel along time before being able to find the right path to it. Once we reached it, I was surprised to see these nice large rooms for the price I was paying. It is very close to the Airport, obviously. When I chose an hotel close to the airport, my expectations are not too high as I am usually spending only one night there to catch an early flight. We got in the shuttle the next morning on time for our flight. What I really liked about this place are the room. Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: keenvisitor
Reviews.Content: New place with spacious rooms and a small cafe (soup, pizza, natchos etc) and bar. Continental breakfast the usual plus waffles. Excellent location very visable from the 20 and very close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “convenient, good service, but not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JBPnfld
Reviews.Content: Good: spacious, comfortable rooms, wireless internet access, convenient location, very helpful service at breakfast (even accommodating us when we showed up for breakfast just as they were closing down) Not so good: rooms on the back get a lot of noise from the highway and train; parking lot was not well plowed and once we had to dig out a space before parking the car; hard to find in the maze of ramps around the airport -- needs better signage to get you there (tip: cut through the parking lot of the Best Western); housekeeping miscue (because we checked in late in the evening, our room was left off the list for housekeeping to clean and make up, so it wasn't made up after our first night, but the housekeeping manager came and personally apologized

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyJayClass
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Fairfield Inn & Suites Montreal Airport in early May before catching an early morning flight. The hotel is brand new, very modern, room rates include breakfast and has free shuttle service over to the airport every 30 minutes. No complaints whatsoever, I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain for a clean new hotel”
Reviews.Author: wrldtravellerToronto
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel there were very few reviews and most just explaining how complicated it was to arrive. We were lucky enough that I programed our GPS and found it no problem, though I can see how if you didnt have one it may be an issue. If you don't mind a bit of a drive to the city centre this is your best bet. The hotel was lovely, everything was new and very clean. The breakfast buffet had a nice array of options and the pool was warm and fun for a dip at night. We had no complaints over all and am planning to return in a few months for my next visit to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property but hard to get too!”
Reviews.Author: sens1992
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Brand new with very nice rooms. Very hard to get to from a tourist point of vue. Even if it is hard to get to, I will stay there again if I go to Montreal. It is a 20 minutes drive to Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: MSDEE1
Reviews.Content: NEW HOTEL as of writing (Nov 24 - 26). Best Fairfield I have ever stayed in!! Best hotel staff that I have seen in all of our travels across the world; so friendly and accomodating. Business travelers frequent here quite a bit. Sleek, chic bright hotel located off of a roundabout and near a rail line. The trick to getting to the hotel if you are driving is to immediately turn off of the roundabout and turn right into the Best Western parking lot. Go to the left and drive behind the parking lot. This will lead you to the front of the Fairfield. My husband and I drove this roundabout twice until we got it right! Self parking fee of $8 CAD (plus tax) with in-out privileges. If you don't want a room facing the rain line, then say so. We stayed in Room 917 for 2 nights and Loved it. Nice sized room. The beds are comfortable, the halls are well lit and bright and carpet is very clean. The bathroom was very clean, too. There is some airplane noise, but this is an airport hotel. Did not hear the trains from our room, but knew there were communter train tracks next to the hotel. Free Wireless Internet. If you do not bring a laptop, there are 2 computers in the business section for guest use. Enjoyed the unlimited continental breakfast that included bacon, egg and cheese quesadillas and waffles. Breakfast ends at 9:30am. Breakfast area is not busy, but it would depend on when you go to eat breakfast. There are two washers and dryers in the on-site laundry room so you can do your own laundry. Hotel is about 20 minute drive to Centre-ville/Downtown Montreal, located right off of the autoroute/highway. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Elvis_was_Here
Reviews.Content: First off, this is a nice little hotel near the Pierre Elliot Trudeau Airport, and right beside the train tracks. The hotel was ready in May 2008, and it's gorgeous. Its still very very clean. My girlfriend and I stayed there for a weekend getaway, and we loved it. As for other reviewers complaining about certain things, here's what we think. Yes, the hotel is a terrible location. The trick to get to the hotel is to cut through the Best Western's hotel parking lot, across the street. AS for noise levels, we had our room facing towards the front side away from the train. We had no problems sleeping, nor could we complain about the outside noise. However, we do suspect that people may have suffered louder noise if their rooms faced the train. Request to have a front faced room, and this will solve your problems. My girlfriend's a light sleeper and she had no problems sleeping. The staff was friendly and helpful (they gave us nice info with places to eat, close by, and they provided a map). Rooms were very clean, and their was even a nice little pool. Also, there was a small workout room too. Continental breakfast was delicious, with the Belgium Waffles. "Come for the Waffles, stay for the beds". We did have one little problem and that was that the tub didn't drain correctly unless the drain tab was lifted. No biggie, as we used an elastic band to get us through. We're sure the staff would have done something had we mentioned it. Parking was cheap at 6 bucks a day, but we noticed some noise from other patrons, but not much. The rooms are fairly sound proofed, but not completely. None of them really are anyways, regardless of which hotel you stay at. Overall: Pros: -Good rates for clean rooms -Continental Breakfast -Clean pool and workout area -Sturdy Beds -Cheap parking -LCD TV (Where did this come from?!? lol) -Friendly and helpful staff Cons: -Terrible location -Hard to find -Eating area is pretty small -Breakfast area ends at 10, and usually has a line

Reviews.Title: “Nice, new, but can be busy. Indoor pool a plus for families.”
Reviews.Author: rdcuff
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading the reviews posted here. Most of them are spot-on: the hotel is right next to a major rail line, so make sure your room heating/AC unit is set to "Fan On" if you are a light sleeper, as this will reduce the extra noise when trains roll past. The hotel has an indoor pool - that's something my two kids always prefer, no matter the season. It's smallish but still decent. The free continental breakfast was slightly above average; the usual assortment of breads, cereals, juices, coffee/tea, plus a waffle maker. The hotel was nearly or entirely full during our stay, so the breakfast room was packed 3 of the 5 mornings we were there. The hotel's location is a plus if you're using the airport. If you're instead spending most of your time downtown, the hotel is a tad remote. However, you can leave your car and take public transit ($2.75 per trip as of 8/08) - by catching the 211 or 221 Express bus at the Dorval train station (a 200 ft walk from the hotel) to the Lionel-Groulx Metro stop (Green line) and then taking the Metro into town -- a published trip time of 32 minutes). We only discovered this option on the last day so couldn't take advantage of it. See http://www.stm.info for more details; use the STM trip planner ("Tous Azimuts"...both in English and French) to build a schedule. Both that bus line and metro operate past midnight. Parking costs $8 per day, unlimited in/out privileges. Make sure to have your room key card encoded for parking lot use, or you'll have to request a key code in person every time you want to exit -- that can be a hassle if the front desk is busy. As others have said, the hotel is hard to get to the first time you try -- it's on a one-way street and you merge onto that street just PAST the hotel entrance, so you have to loop around. If you type in '700 Avenue Michel Jasmin" (the hotel's address) into an online map service (Google Maps or the one at the Fairfield website) you can see what I mean; the directions those services provide are accurate. I found the hotel staff overall very helpful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBusyWoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of airport proximity. Had not previously stayed in a Fairfield and was really impressed by the friendly, helpful staff, the convenient services, and the good value. Facilities were very nice -- I thought the small fitness room was well equipped for this level of hotel. Indoor pool looked well maintained. They provided some good restaurant recommendations and a map to the nearest gas station (not far), but roads are very confusing in that area since there are so many highways coming together. Room was clean, comfortable, and a good size. Cont. breakfast was good, including belgian waffles you can make yourself. My only complaint was the noise from the trains -- quite loud even at the highest floors. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A GEM of a hotel in the location from HELL.”
Reviews.Author: LBTB
Reviews.Content: Travelling by car, in town two nights to attend a family function.. The location of this brand new hotel was a nightmare. It is situated on the edge of two roundabouts (all signs in french) which facilitate entry to the airport. Please keep in mind that we grew up in this area and are very familiar with the "Dorval Circle" flow of traffic but there are no words to describe how difficult it is get get to this hotel. If I found it a challenge to get to, I cannot begin to imagine what a tourist would go through to get to this location. When we finally did arrive I asked the desk clerk to give me his rendition of directions and if I'd followed his directions I'd still be in the car!! I can't fault him however, because I don't even think I could give directions in this case, it simply defies words. Oh the noise.......This hotel is located directly beside a major train station and freight line. With freight trains passing 200 feet from your room all night don't expect to get any sleep. The hotel itself is brand new, the room was very nice, exceptionally clean and the staff are friendly. No faults there, everything you would expect from a Marriott hotel. (I'd give the hotel itself 4 stars). The rate is quite reasonable however the trade off of location an noise is just not worth the savings. I would have gladly paid an extra $60 per night to get some sleep. Sorry to say but we would recommend giving this GEM a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New & Well Done”
Reviews.Author: Canadalovestotravel
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there after long flight from Rome. Glad to be back at a Marriott style Hotel. Very kind front desk people. Brand new Hotel, as was less then 2 months old when we stayed. Increadibly clean and good breakfast. 32inch LCD Tv was a bonus. Big rooms and Marriott level bedding which we always appreciate. Watch out as cabs charge a minimum $12 from Airport to about 2km from Airport, a ripoff. Take the shuttle for free. Recommend it as a GREAT STAY.

Reviews.Title: “More like a 5 star property”
Reviews.Author: mb7777
Reviews.Content: The Fairfield at the Montreal airport is more like a 5 star property than your standard Fairfield. I usually stay at Marriott properties and normally find the Fairfield line a little less expensive but quite sufficient compared to the Courtyard or high rise selections, so I was prepared for the usual Fairfield level of hotel. This particular one was very new and so clean you could eat off the floor if desired. There wasn't a speck of dirt or dust anywhere in the entire hotel and the lobby is quite impressive. Highly recommended.
